required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase1 Study to Explore the Safety of EOS789 in Patients With Chronic Kidney Disease and Hyperphosphatemia on Hemodialysis
clinical_study.official_title: A Single-center, Randomized, 2-Period, Crossover, Study to Explore The Safety, Pharmacokinetics, Pharmacodynamics, and Efficacy of EOS789 in Patients With Chronic Kidney Disease and Hyperphosphatemia on Hemodialysis

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a randomized study designed as a 2x2 cross-over in two periods (Period 1 and Period 2) to assess the safety, pharmacokinetics (PK), pharmacodynamics (PD), and efficacy of EOS789 in patients with chronic kidney disease (CKD) and hyperphosphatemia receiving hemodialysis. Period 1 is double-blind and Period 2 is open-label. Period 1 and Period 2 are identical with regard to the design, inclusion/exclusion criteria, and assessments. EOS789 and its combination with sevelamer carbonate are tested in Period 1 and Period 2 respectively.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to Day 42 in each treatment sequence

primary_outcome.measure: Safety: Change from baseline in vital signs
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to Day 42 in each treatment sequence
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in vital signs (systolic blood pressure, diastolic blood pressure, pulse rate)

primary_outcome.measure: Safety: Change from baseline in clinical laboratory tests
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to Day 42 in each treatment sequence
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in clinical laboratory tests (hematology, biochemistry, coagulation)

primary_outcome.measure: Safety: Change from baseline in 12 lead ECGs
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to Day 42 in each treatment sequence
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in 12 lead ECGs

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 4, 9, 10, 11 in the first treatment sequence in each period

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics: Total exposure (area under the curve [AUC])
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 10 in the first treatment sequence in each period
Day 10 in the first treatment sequence in each period
Day 10 in the first treatment sequence in each period

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics: Removal ratio of EOS789 by hemodialysis at steady state
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 9 in the first treatment sequence in each period

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacodynamics: Intestinal fractional phosphorus absorption and accumulated fecal excretion of phosphorus
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Days 11 to 13 in the first treatment sequence and second treatment sequence in each period

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy: Change from baseline of serum phosphorus (P), Calcium (Ca), Ca x P, intact parathyroid hormone (PTH), and fibroblast growth factor (FGF23) at Day 13
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 13 in the first treatment sequence and second treatment sequence in each period

arm_group.description: EOS789 Dose 1 in treatment sequence 1, Placebo in treatment sequence 2
Placebo in treatment sequence 1, EOS789 Dose 1 in treatment sequence 2
EOS789 Dose 2 in treatment sequence 1, EOS789 Dose 2 + Sevelamer carbonate in treatment sequence 2
EOS789 Dose 2 + Sevelamer carbonate in treatment sequence 1, EOS789 Dose 2 in treatment sequence 2

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with CKD and hyperphosphatemia must meet the following criteria for study entry:
- Age ≥18 years
- On thrice-weekly hemodialysis for at least 3 months prior to screening
- Not having changed dialysis prescription within 4 weeks prior to screening for dialyzer, calcium concentration in dialysate, or dry weight more than 1 kg
- Receiving stable doses of treatments affecting serum phosphorus for at least 4 weeks prior to screening and willing to discontinue these treatments
Exclusion Criteria:
－ Patients with CKD and hyperphosphatemia who meet any of the following criteria will be excluded from study entry:
- Uncontrolled diabetes and/or hypertension in the opinion of the investigators
- Uncontrolled chronic constipation and/or diarrhea in the opinion of the investigators
- Hospitalization for cardiac disease in previous 3 months
- Evidence of acute or chronic hepatitis or known liver cirrhosis
- Aspartate aminotransferase (AST) and/or alanine aminotransferase (ALT) >2.5 x upper limit of normal (ULN)
